Looks like sync info has been corrupted. Dirk, could you send us 
your .syncinfo files for the projects you have as source?

Created an attachment (id=5449)
My sync infos

We ae unable to reproduce this. I have released better error handling for this 
case. We no longer NPE and information will be logged to help us better debug 
the problem.

This still happens on build I20030715. The message in the log is:

!SESSION Jul 16, 2003 12:27:52.210 --------------------------------------------
-
java.fullversion=J2RE 1.3.1 IBM J9 build 20030605 (JIT enabled)
BootLoader constants: OS=win32, ARCH=x86, WS=win32, NL=en_US
Command-line arguments: -os win32 -ws win32 -arch x86 -showlocation -data 
c:\home\dbaeumer\devel\workspaces\eclipse -install file:C:/apps/eclipse/latest/
!ENTRY org.eclipse.ui 4 4 Jul 16, 2003 12:27:52.210
!MESSAGE Could not create view: 'org.eclipse.team.ui.sync.SyncView'.
!ENTRY org.eclipse.team.cvs.core 4 4 Jul 16, 2003 12:30:29.683
!MESSAGE Synchronization bytes are missing for 
resource '/org.eclipse.jdt.ui.tests.refactoring/resources/InlineMethodWorkspace
/TestCases/bin/simple_out' in synchronization 
partner 'org.eclipse.team.cvs:remote-resource-key'.

Since the old sync view is gone I am not able to synchronize my workspace 
anymore. That's why I raised the PR to blocker.

I am still getting the entry in the log and an empty sync view even if I 
replace the org.eclipse.jdt.ui.tests.refactoring project with the latest 
version from the repository

Deleting the offending project and reloading it from the repository did help.

Another point:

- synchronizing project B having the bogus project in the workspace fails. Why 
can't you synchronize project B if the sync info of project A is corrupt.

I've noticed that InlineMethodWorkspace/TestCases/bin doesn't exist in the
repository. How was it created locally?
It is created by the Java compiler (it is an output folder).

I haven't been able to reproduce this one yet. Dirk seems to of been able to
workaround for the time being though and the old sync view is re-enabled in M2.
Moving to M3 and changed severity to major.

Basically, resources created by the builder should of been ignored by CVS.
I fixed it by deleting the project and checking it out again.

I have the same problems. When I try to open the Sync View:
!ENTRY org.eclipse.team.cvs.core 4 4 ?????? 18, 2003 13:46:21.142
!MESSAGE Synchronization bytes are missing for 
resource '/ru.gorod.docstorage2/filldocs/classes/ru/gorod/docstorage2/filldata'
 in synchronization partner 'org.eclipse.team.cvs:remote-resource-key'.

Directory 'filldocs/classes/ru/...' is created by the Java compiler.
To solve the problem I have to close the "bogus" project. Then open the Sync 
View. After that I reopen the project. Now Sync View works correctly with this 
project.

We have still been unable to reproduce this. I have added logging to both the 
set and get of the sync info to ensure that the parent sync info exists. 
Invalid cases will be logged and processing will continue so that the invalid 
state does not prevent synching. I am marking this as Remind to indicate that 
the problem has not been fixed. Please reopen and attach the new logged 
information if the problem occurs again.

Our usual practice is to move bugs to the RESOLVED REMIND state when there is not enough information provided to address the reported issue and more information has been requested. This bug has been in the RESOLVED REMIND state for quite some time so it is being CLOSED. If you can provide the requested information or you otherwise feel that this is still an issue, please reopen the bug. If you are unable to open it due to a lack or permissions, please add a comment to the bug stating that you would like to have the request reconsidered.  I applogize for this blanket approach to bug screening but there are just to many bugs in the REMIND state for us to effectively triage them. Your help in this matter is appreciated.
